group1.aText: Plants aquatic. Leaves peltate. Thalamus spongy
group1.bText: Plants terrestrial. Leaves and thalamus not as above
Calyx not as above. Perianth 3 to many-seriate

group1.aText: Fls. fragrant, bright yellow. Anthers introrse.Receptacle elongate, columnar.
group1.bText: Fls. not as above. Anthers extrose. Receptacle short, sub-globose.

group1.aText: Style passes through the staminal tube.
group1.bText: Style free from the staminal tube

group1.aText: Fls, zygomorphic with largest petal crestate
group1.bText: Fls. act inomorphiec. Petal not crestate.

group1.aText: Fls. in globose head. Fruits pod or lomentum.
group1.bText: Fls. not in globose head. Fruits otherwise.

group1.aText: Leaves pinnatifid. Fls. bright yellow. Frts. prickly.
group1.bText: Leaves not incised.Fls. otherwise. Frts.not prickly

group1.aText: Leaves compound with pellucid glands beneath

group1.bText: Plants not fleshy. Fruits echinate (except Chorchorus)
Leaves pinnately veined(except Grevia). Placentation axile

group1.aText: Leaves palmately lobed. Fls. bright yellow. Capsules 3-5 valved, smooth: seeds cottony.
group1.bText: Leaves not lobed. Fls. pinkish. Capeules 2-valved, echinate: seeds not cottony.

group1.aText: Leaves silvery beneath. Stanena in bundles.Staminodes present.
group1.bText: Leaves not an above. Stanens free. Staminodes absent.

group1.aText: Fls. white. Calyx caducous. Fruitt's baccate.
group1.bText: Fls. purple or cream. coloured. Calyx persistent. Fruitt's Capsule.

group1.aText: Stamens 10, often reduced to staminode. Pods elongate,flat.
group1.bText: Stamens less than 10. Fruits not as above.

group1.aText: Leaves apically not ched. Calyx-tubes spathaceous.Petals clawed.
group1.bText: Leaves not as above. Calyx-tubes campanulate. Petals not clawed

group1.aText: Capsules pyriform, winged at angles. Stanena 8.
Leaf-rachis glandular. Fls. irregular. Staminodes present.
group1.bText: Leaf-rachis glandular. Fls. irregular. Staminodes absent

group1.aText: plants fleshy .Stipules absent.fls .not less than 3cm. acroes, Capsules many seeded (except hydrocera).
group1.bText: Plants not Elestry. iples peament. Fila. not more than 1 cm. across. Capacles fow needed.
Leaves opposite or pseudo-shorled. Fls. mostly white (pinkish in Polycarpaea corymbose).

group1.aText: Leaves entire. Stipules scarious. Int. terminal, corystone cyme
group1.bText: Leaves crenate-serrate. Ripules ne acarious. Pls. axillary clust erad cyme.

group1.aText: Leaflets many (not less than 20 pairs.) Fls. in globose heads.
group1.bText: Leaflets few (not more than 6 pairs.) Fls. not in heads.
Fruits berry, globose. Seeds not arillate.

group1.aText: Thorns 4 at each node. Leaves spine-tipped
group1.bText: Thorna solitary or paired. Leaves not spine tipped

group1.aText: Leaves basally nerved. Petala reduced or absent
group1.bText: Thorna solitary or paired. Leaves without basal nerves, Petals vell developed.
Stamens twice as many as petals or fewer

group1.aText: Large trees. Leaves compound. Fls. yellow.
group1.bText: Scandent shrubs. Leaves simple. Fls. white.

group1.aText: Inf. axillary raceme. Staminodes present.Ovules 1 per call. Drupes half enclosed by calyx.
group1.bText: Inf. axillary umbel. Staminodes absent.Ovules 2 or more per call. Drupes not asabove.

group1.aText: Leaves scaly, jointed with enclosed sheathing base. Ple. in close cylindric spike.
group1.bText: Leaves not as above. Fle. arranged otherwise.

group1.aText: Leaves lobed at apex, palmately nerved.
Leaves and drupes aromatic, mango smelling.(except Lannea).
group1.bText: Leaves and drupes not as above.

group1.aText: Leaflets many (15-17 pairs), small (0.4-1.0cm. long). Pls. yellowish with pinkish dots.
group1.bText: Leaflets few (1-4 pairs), large (1.5-5.0 cm. long). Fls. white (except Cymometra).
Fls. bisexual. Stamens not as above.

group2.aText: Plants aquatic
group2.bText: Plants terrestrial

group2.aText: Rhizomes present. Petals many
group2.bText: Rhizomes absent. Petals 2-5.

group2.aText: Leaves submerged; leaves linear or finely dissected into filiform segments. Pls. in axillary clustered cyme
group2.bText: Leaves floating, solitary. obovate or rhomboid. Pls. axillary

group2.aText: Leaves rhomboid, dentate. Fls.4-merous. Capsules with 2 horns
group2.bText: Leaves obovate or oblanceolate, entire. Pls. 5-merous. Capsules without horns

group2.aText: Plant a thorny or spinous.
group2.bText: Plants unarmed

group2.aText: Stems flattened or columinar, joint ed. Stamens indefinite. Becry spiny or brietly.
group2.bText: Stems flattened or columinar, joint ed. Stamens indefinite. Becry spiny or brietly.

group2.aText: Inf. axillary cyme. Fle. white. Sepals and petals 10 each. Petals recurved.
group2.bText: Inf. axillary cyme. Fle. white. Sepals and petals 10 each. Petals recurved.

group2.aText: Herbs.
group2.bText: trees or shrubs

group2.aText: Plants prost rate. Fls. in umbellate cyme
group2.bText: Plants erect. Inf. otherwise.

group2.aText: Plants insectivorous. Leaves glandular-hairy.
group2.bText: Plants not insectivorous. Leaves not so

group2.aText: Fls. yellow.
group2.bText: Pls, other than yellow.

group2.aText: Inf. terminal cyme. Calyx stellately brist ly
group2.bText: Int. axillary, clustered cyme. Calyx not as above.

group2.aText: fls. white. Styles 2
group2.bText: Fls. pale-rosy. Style one

group2.aText: Climbers / Stragglers.
group2.bText: Plants not climbing

group2.aText: Plante tendril bearing. Stamens 5.
group2.bText: Plants without tendril. Stanens

group2.aText: Leaves palmately 3-lobed, foetid, glandular beneath. Bracts laciniate. Fruits baccate
group2.bText: Leaves and bracts not as above. Fruits winged

group2.aText: Secondary nerves obscure.
group2.bText: Secondary nerves of the leaves prominent

group2.aText: Fls. blue. Stamens 8. Berry dark purple. Plants not littoral.
group2.bText: Fls. not as above. Stamens 10 or more. Berry red or green. Plants littoral (except Carallia).

group2.aText: Inf. terminal raceme or spike
group2.bText: Inf. axillary condensed or 3-chotomous cyme.

group2.aText: Fls. large (not less than 3.0 cm. across). white with purple blotch. Stamena nany.
group2.bText: Fls. amall (not more than 2.0 cm. across).yellow or white, without purple blotch.Stamens 8-26 (except Kandelia

group2.aText: Starens 10 or less
group2.bText: Stamens more than 10.

group2.aText: Petals absent. Stamena 5+5. Fruits winged or angled.
group2.bText: Petals present. Stamens not as above. Pruitt's neither angled nor winged.

group2.aText: Leaves serrate. Fls. white. Stamens similar, as many an petals.
group2.bText: Leaves entire. Fls. mauve-purple. Stamena dimorphic, twice as many as petals.

group2.aText: Leaves alternate, clustered at the apices. Fruits baccate or angular.
group2.bText: Leaves opposite, not clustered at the apices. Fruits not as above.

group2.aText: Leaves aromatic when bruised. Fls. mall (not more than 0.5 cm. acrosa): mostly white
group2.bText: Leaves not aromatic. Pls. large (not less than 1.0 cm. across): mauve or purple (except Lageret roemia parviflora)

group3.aText: Ovary inferior or semi-inferior
group3.bText: Ovary superior.

group3.aText: Petals with tendrils. Placentation parietal.
group3.bText: Plants without tendril. Placentation other than parietal.

group3.aText: Inf. capitulum or fla. aggregated in a head (except Gnaphalium polucaulon). Calyx often reduced to pappus..
group3.bText: Inf. not as above. Calyx well-developed. 4. Leaves opposite. Stipules inter or intra-petiolar..

group3.aText: Leaves opposite. Stipules inter or intra-petiolar.
group3.bText: Leaves alternate, exstipulate.

group3.aText: Leaves opposite. Stipules inter or intra-petiolar.
group3.bText: Leaves alternate, exstipulate.

group3.aText: Plants insect ivorous or parasitic. Leaves inconspicuous or absent.
group3.bText: plants not an above. Leaves well developed.

group3.aText: Stem twining. Corolla actinomorphic. Ovules 4.
group3.bText: Stem not twining. Corolla zygomorphic. Ovules many.

group3.aText: Aquatic or marahy, alender herba: usually insectivorous. Stamens 2.
group3.bText: Terrestrial, et out herba: root parasites or saprophytes. Stamens 4.

group3.aText: Aquatic or marahy, alender herba: usually insectivorous. Stamens 2.
group3.bText: Terrestrial, et out herba: root parasites or saprophytes. Stamens 4.

group3.aText: Plants dioecious. Fls. unisexual.
group3.bText: Plants monoecious. Fls. bisexual.

group3.aText: Leaves compound
group3.bText: leaves simple.

group3.aText: Fls. in globose head or in spike. Fruits legume or lomentum.
group3.bText: Fls. neither in globose head nor in spike. Fruits drueps or capsules.

group3.aText: Erect herbs. Inf. terminal umbel. Stamens 10.
group3.bText: Large shrubs or tree.

group3.aText: Leaves palmately compound.
group3.bText: Leaves pinnately compound

group3.aText: Inf. terminal raceme. Corolla creamish yellow. Ovules many.
group3.bText: Inf. leaf-opposed, corymbose Corolla greenish-white. Ovary 1-ovuled. cyme

group3.aText: Leaves alternate or apparently sub-opposite.
group3.bText: Leven opposite or whorled (except Corbera manghan).

group3.aText: Starena opposite the petals.
group3.bText: Stamens alternate with petals.

group3.aText: Treen, laticiferous. Stamens more than corolla lobes.
group3.bText: Herbs or shrubs, not laticiferous. Stamens as many as or less than corolla lobes.

group3.aText: Plovers salver-shaped. Calyx with stalked glande (except Aegialitis). Styles 5.
group3.bText: Flowers rotate. Calyx eglandular. Style 1.

group3.aText: Large shrubs. Leaves usually gland-dotted. Pla. pink or white, fleshy. Fruits follicle or drupe
group3.bText: Herbs. Leaves not gland dotted. Fls. blue. Perianth not fleshy. Fruits capsule.

group3.aText: Plants floating. Leaves orbicular.
group3.bText: Plants not floating (except Ipomoea aquatica).

group3.aText: Ovules one or two in each loculea..
group3.bText: Oralee many in each loculus.

group3.aText: Fls. blue. Filaments exceeding the corolla tube.
group3.bText: Fis. not blue. Filaments included in the corolla tube.

group3.aText: Corolla ventricose. Fruits distinctly grooved or provided with spines.
group3.bText: Corolla not ventricose. Fruits not as above.

group3.aText: Corolla yellow. Statens 4. Fruit a capsule. Placentation median.
group3.bText: Corolla purple or white. Stanna 5. Fruit a berry.Placentation oblique..

group3.aText: Plants with milky latex. Anthars connate or connivent around the stigma.
group3.bText: Plants without lates. Anthers free.

group3.aText: Nectariferous corona present. Anthers Insuperable. connate with stigma (Gyrategium). Pollon assed collected into pollinia.
group3.bText: Nectarifercus corona about. Anthers separable,convenient around the stigma. Pallen masses not collected into pollinis.

group3.aText: Corolla regular or sub-cupular.
group3.bText: Corolla irregular.

group3.aText: Ovary one-called.
group3.bText: Ovary two-celled..

group3.aText: Straggling shrubs. Leaves flechy. Inf. terminal panicle.Placentation basal.pollinia.
group3.bText: Straggling shrubs. Leaves flechy. Inf. terminal panicle.Placentation basal.

group3.aText: Stamens 2..
group3.bText: Stamens as many as corolla-lobes..

group3.aText: Plants littoral. Leaves pinnately nerved. Inf. axillary or terminal 3-chotomous panicle.Corolla.
group3.bText: Plants not littoral. Leaves palmately nerved. Inf. axillary solitary or cyme. Corolla white.Ovules

group3.aText: Corolla distinctly bi-lipped..
group3.bText: Corolla not distinctly bi-lipped.

group3.aText: Styles gynobasic..
group3.bText: Styles not gynobasic.

group3.aText: Fertile stamens 2..
group3.bText: Fertile stamens 4.

group3.aText: Corolla glandular pubescent. Capsules tipped with hooked spines.
group3.bText: Corolla eglandular. Fruits not as above.

group3.aText: Seeds with retinacula (except Nelsonia).
group3.bText: Seeds without retinacula.

group3.aText: Corolla bilipped except (Scoparia). Ovulee many in each cell.
group3.bText: Corolla not bilipped ovules few (1-2 only) in each cell.

group4.aText: Fls. solitary, axillary. Stamens 16-24. Stigma simple.
group4.bText: Fls. in terminal spike. Stamens 4. Stigma plumose.
Plants not twinning, leafy (except Viscum nepalense).

group4.aText: Plants with milky latex. Inf. axillary, globose head.
group4.bText: Plants without milky latex. Inf. not as above.

group4.aText: Thorns straight. Leaves glandular pubescent. Inf. terminal panicled racené.
group4.bText: Thorns recurved. Leaves not as above. Inf. axillary or terminal cyme.

group4.aText: Thorns straight. Leaves glandular pubescent. Inf. terminal panicled racené.
group4.bText: Thorns recurved. Leaves not as above. Inf. axillary or terminal cyme.

group4.aText: Plants tendrillate. Ochreate stipule present. Fls.rose-purple.
group4.bText: Plants without tendril. Ochreate stipule absent.

group4.aText: Plants with stinging hairs. Ovary deeply 3-lobed.
group4.bText: Plants without stinging hairs. Ovary not as above.

group4.aText: Leaves panduriform. Perianths 6-lobed. Fruits globose capsule.
group4.bText: Leaves not as above. Perianths 5-lobed. Fruits not as above
Berbe (except Boehmeria which is an underahrub).

group4.aText: Plants with milky latex. Fls. unisexual. Tepals 3-4.
group4.bText: Plants without milky latex. Fls. bisexual. Tepals 5.

group4.aText: Petals absent. Stamens less than 10. Seeds arillate.
group4.bText: Petala present. Stamens 10. Seeds not arillate.

group4.aText: Leaves aromatic when bruished. Unbels surrounding by 4-5bract
group4.bText: Leaves and inf. not as above.

group4.aText: Leaves digitate or lobed. Fls. orange or purplish inside. Ovary 4-5 celled.
group4.bText: Leaves not as above. Fls. greenish or cream coloured.

group4.aText: Stamens isomerous. Ovary bicarpellary. Stigmas bifid.

group4.bText: Stipules absent, if present not ochreate.

group4.aText: Fls. unisexual. Styles linear or filiform.
group4.bText: Pls. bisexual. Style not as above

group4.aText: Fls. aggregated in the form of globose or cylindrical clustered spike. Tepala aristate.
group4.bText: Pls. not as above. Tepals not aristate.

group4.aText: Leaves reniform or orbicular. Ple in umbellate cyme.
group4.bText: Leaves not as above. Fls. axillary solitary

group4.aText: Teapals pink. Ovary 1-ovuled. Fruits ribbed and glandular.
group4.bText: Tepala greenish-shite. Ovary many ovuled. Fruit not an above.
Hypanthium absent. Fls. in terminal spike. Ovary superior

group5.aText: Plant body very much reduced, represented by 1 or 2 fronds only.
Perianth represented by glumes or reduced to scales or bristles
Plants dioecious. Leaves spiralled, spinescent. Fls. arranged in spadix, strongly fragrant.Spathes present.
group5.bText: Plants monoecious. Leaves distichous, not spinescent. Fls. arranged in spikelets. Spathes absent.

group5.aText: Leaf spongy. inf. terminal cylindrical spike. Glumas absent.
group5.bText: Leaves not spongy. Inf, of head or spikelets of florets. Glumes present

group5.aText: Stems without nodes. Leaven 3-ranked, not ligulate with closed sheaths. Pla. enclosed by one glume. Styles 1. Seede 2-3 angled.
group5.bText: Stems with nodes. Leaves 2-ranked, ligulate. with open sheaths. Pls. enclosed by 2-glumen, rarely one. Stylen 2. Seeds rounded

group5.aText: Fls. bisexual, yellow, Dracts dark-brown, coriaceous.Capsule many needed
group5.bText: Pls. unisexual, diety shite. Bracts not as above. Capsule 2-3 needed.Eriocaulaceae

group5.aText: Plante free floating, submerged or marshy
Leaves radical, sagittate or ovate.it amana 6-24,
Stem arborescent. Leaves pinnately or palmately divided.
group5.bText: Stem not as above. Leaves entire.
Inf. axillary umbellate cyme or racene.

group5.aText: Plants epiphytic (except Geodorum, Habenaria,and Peristylus). Median petal produced into a lip (labellum). Stanen and style united into a column.
group5.bText: Planet terrestrial. Median petal not an above. Stamen and style separate.

group5.aText: Plants without rhizomatous stem (except Cyanotia tuberosa tuberose in which root stock)

group5.bText: Perianth segments connate white or purple.

group6.aText: Branches, leaves and sporangia bearing structure all arranged in whorls, stem ribbed, aerial, jointed and hollowed
Leaves microphyllous, with single central vein, sporangia borne singly on the upper side of fertile pinnae near base
group6.bText: Leaves megaphyllous, with various types of veins, sporangia borne on the margin or on the abaxial surface of lamina generally in clusters.

group6.aText: Spores one kind, leaves without ligules, vegetative leaves usually monomorphic
group6.bText: Spores two kinds, leaves with ligule, vegetative lea mostl dimorphic

group6.aText: Plant isodichotomously branched, roots basal, sporangia cauline or axillary,spores pitted
group6.bText: Plants monopodially branched, roots scattered, sporangia foliar, spores without pits.

group6.aText: Sporangia originating from a group of cells (Eusporangiate); its wallconsist of several layer of cells
group6.bText: Sporangia originated from single superficial cells; its wall consists of a single layer of cells.

group6.aText: Rhizome short, fleshy, without scales, leaves not circinate in bud, without stipule at base.
group6.bText: Rhizome erect, massive or horizontal. Leaves circinate in buds with stipules like appendages at base

group6.aText: Venation dichotomous, open, sterile blade pinnate or tripartite with many small ultimate division. Sporangia globose, dehiscing horizontally.Gametophyte simple, unbranche
group6.bText: Venation reticulate, sterile blades simple. Sproangia arranged in two lateral rows. Gametophyte branched

group6.aText: Aquatic or marshy plants
Sporangia borne in sporocarps
group6.bText: Sporangia protected by reflexed leaf margin

group6.aText: Plants floating in water
Tree ferns
Fronds dichotomously or pseudodichotomously branched with a dormant but at the axil of the fork.
Plants climbing or clinging.
Plants clinging, with distinct humous collecting fronds.
group6.bText: Plants climbing/twinning, without separate umous collecting fronds

group6.aText: Lamina usually one cell thick and without stomata
Sporangia protected by reflexed margin of lamina
group6.bText: Sporangia not protected by reflexed margin of lamina

group6.aText: Sporangia borne on inner surface of reflexed portion of lamina
group6.bText: Sporangia bome along the margin on the surface of lamina

group6.aText: Pseudoindusium continuous.
Rhizome hairy
Rhizome hairy
Sporangia borne along veins
Rhizome scales clathrate.
group6.bText: Rhizome scales usually non-clathrate or sometimes subclathrate

group6.aText: Veins dichotomously forked.
Sori round, oval or linear and in some cases achrostichoid, exindusiate.
Generally epiphytic ferns
Pinnac articulated to rachis.
Indusium consists of tuft of multicellular hairs
Sori parallel to costa
Sori marginal
Indusium 'J' shaped along or crossing the veins.
Rachis grooved on dorsal side, opening towards rachillae groove
group6.bText: Rachis without dorsal groove or if grooved, not open to rachillae

group6.aText: Unicellular hairs abundant at least on dorsal side of costa, indusium round and reniform
group6.bText: Multicellular hairs usually present at least on dorsal side of rachis, rachillac and costa.
